Class Piece

java.lang.Object
application.Piece
All Implemented Interfaces:
Enums
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
abstract class Piece extends Object implements Enums
Abstract class representing a chess piece

Shady

    • Piece

      public Piece​(Enums.Players color, int x, int y)
      Parameters:
      color - - The color of player the piece belongs to.
      x - - The column the piece is on.
      y - - The row the piece is on.

      public Piece​(Enums.Players color, Coordinate coor)
      Parameters:
      color - - The player the piece belongs to.
      coor - - The coordinate the piece will be placed on.

  • Method Details

    • moved

      public void moved()
      Number of moves and hasMoved boolean are updated.

    • getImage

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getImage()
      Each piece has PNG representing the piece's type.
      Returns:
      The image associated with the piece.

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition​(int x, int y)
      Moves the piece to the CCS coordinate based on the info given.
      Parameters:
      x - - The column the piece is moved to.
      y - - The row the piece is moved to.

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition​(Coordinate coor)
      After a move, each piece acquires a new position.
      Parameters:
      coor - - The new position of the piece.

    • getPosition

      public Coordinate getPosition()
      Returns:
      A Coordinate instance variable with the location of the piece.

    • getAvaliablePositions

      public abstract List<Coordinate> getAvaliablePositions()
      Each type of piece has their own system of finding available positions
      Returns:
      A list of all the available coordinates the piece can be moved to.

    • getInitial

      public abstract String getInitial()
      Each piece has an initial representing its type.
      Returns:
      A one char string.

    • ConstructRest

      protected abstract void ConstructRest()
      Constructs the rest of the piece that isn't made by inherited constructors.

    • isOnLine

      public boolean isOnLine​(Coordinate coor)
      Calculates all the possible moves of the pieces and then determines if the argument is valid.
      Parameters:
      coor - - the tile being verified
      Returns:
      boolean indicating if the piece can move to the passed coordinate.

    • verticalCoordinates

      protected List<Coordinate> verticalCoordinates()
      The process to find the available vertical coordinates above and below the piece is split between two methods: verticalTop() and verticalBottom()
      Returns:
      All the coordinates in a piece's column that the piece can be moved to.

    • verticalTop

      protected List<Coordinate> verticalTop()
      Returns:
      The top half of the verticalCoordinates() method

    • verticalBottom

      protected List<Coordinate> verticalBottom()
      Returns:
      The bottom half of the verticalCoordinates() method

    • horizontalCoordinates

      protected List<Coordinate> horizontalCoordinates()
      The process to find the available horizontal coordinates to the left and right of the piece is split between two methods: horizontalLeft() and horizontalRight()
      Returns:
      All the coordinates in a piece's row that the piece can be moved to.

    • negativeDiagonalCoordinates

      protected List<Coordinate> negativeDiagonalCoordinates()
      The negative diagonal line is identical to a y = -x line. Coordinates that contain pieces of the same color or the piece itself are not in the returned list. The process to find the available coordinates is split between two methods: negativeDiagonalLeft() and negativeDiagonalRight()
      Returns:
      A list of coordinates the piece can be moved to based on a negatively sloped diagonal line.

    • positiveDiagonalCoordinates

      protected List<Coordinate> positiveDiagonalCoordinates()
      The positive diagonal line is identical to a y = x line Coordinates that contain pieces of the same color or the piece itself are not in the returned list. The process to find the available coordinates is split between two methods: positiveDiagonalRight() and positiveDiagonalLeft()
      Returns:
      All the coordinates the piece can be moved to based on a positively sloped diagonal line.

    • surroundingCoordinates

      protected List<Coordinate> surroundingCoordinates​(int yManip)
      Finds the coordinates of tiles directly in contact with the piece's tile.
      Parameters:
      yManip - - Changes the row to acquire coordinates from with respect to the piece's current row.
      Returns:
      A list of valid coordinates that surround the piece.

    • CreatePieces

      public static List<Piece> CreatePieces()
      The process to create all the pieces for the board.
      Returns:
      A full set of Chess Pieces with preset coordinates.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string of the type (Piece type).

    • matches

      public boolean matches​(Piece piece)
      Equivalent to a .equals()
      Parameters:
      piece - - The piece being compared with.
      Returns:
      True if argument matches this piece's type and color. False if either of the two conditions aren't met.

    • isCastleCoordinate

      public boolean isCastleCoordinate​(Coordinate coor)
      A king moving to a coordinate might either result in a castle move or regular move. The process to determine if it can castle to either side is split between two methods: CanCastleLeft() and CanCastleRight()
      Parameters:
      coor - - The coordinate the player wants to move the piece to.
      Returns:
      Boolean indicating whether or not the requested move should result in a castle move.

    • CanCastleRight

      protected boolean CanCastleRight()
      Returns:
      Boolean indicating whether or not the king piece can castle with its right-hand side rook

    • CanCastleLeft

      protected boolean CanCastleLeft()
      Returns:
      Boolean indicating whether or not the king piece can castle with its left-hand side rook

    • IsEnPassantCoordinate

      public boolean IsEnPassantCoordinate​(Coordinate coor)
      Pawns can only en passant other pawns.
      Parameters:
      coor - - The coordinate the player wants to move the piece to.
      Returns:
      Boolean indicating whether or not the requested move should result in an En Passant move.
